text.div:
Properties

CodeURLTypeDescription
statushttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#statuscodeStatus of the concept
deprecatedhttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-table-deprecatedcodeVersion of HL7 in which the code was deprecated
v2-concCommenthttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-concCommentstringV2 Concept Comment

This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0287 defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinitionV2 Concept Comment
AD ADDADD
CO CORRECTCORRECT
DE DELETEDELETE
LI LINKLINK
SP Used in Snapshot modeDeclares when segment falls under snapshot mode handling, i.e. all elements that were previously sent will be sent, not just any changesSnapshot mode is the expected default; use this code to explicitly state that.
UC UNCHANGEDUNCHANGED *The UNCHANGED action code is used to signify to the applications programs that this particular segment includes no information to be modified. It is supplied in order to identify the correct record for which the following modification is intended
UN UNLINKUNLINK
UP UPDATEUPDATE

Additional Language Displays

COändern
DElöschen
LIverknüpfen
SP
UC
UNVerknüpfung auflösen
UPändern

name: ProblemGoalAction
title: problem-goalAction
description: HL7-defined code system of concepts used in Patient Care for the intent of a problem or goal.  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the GOL, ROL, PRB and PTH segments.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0287 (Problem/Goal Action Code)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

property.description: Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

concept.definition: Declares when segment falls under snapshot  mode handling, i.e. all elements that were previously sent will be sent, not just any changes

property.valueString: Snapshot mode is the expected default; use this code to explicitly state that.

The UNCHANGED action code is used to signify to the applications programs that this particular segment includes no information to be modified.  It is supplied in order to identify the correct record for which the following modification is intended
